title: New York Democratic congresswoman hospitalized
text:
Rep. Carolyn Maloney Carolyn Bosher MaloneyCast and crew of 'Unbelievable' join lawmakers to advocate for reducing DNA, rape kit backlog O'Rourke gun confiscation talk alarms Democrats 2017 marked first year firearms killed more people than car accidents: study MORE (D-N.Y.) was hospitalized Monday following an unspecified medical episode, according to the New York Daily News.

Maloney, 73, reportedly complained of pain earlier in the day and said she could not see. Staffers then escorted her to a bench where she sat while 911 was called, according to the tabloid.

ADVERTISEMENT

"She is fine, doing well and appreciates everyone's well wishes and concerns," Maloney spokesperson Jennifer Bell told WCBS Newsradio.

The episode reportedly occurred while Maloney was attending a Manhattan-area vigil for four homeless men murdered in Chinatown over the weekend. Her office said she was taken to New York–Presbyterian Hospital out of an abundance of caution.

“The Congresswoman is doing well and just waiting on final word from her doctor as to when she can be discharged,” Bell told The Hill in a statement.

Maloney had been scheduled to attend an event on helicopter safety with House Judiciary Committee Chairman Jerrold Nadler Jerrold (Jerry) Lewis NadlerThe 13 House Democrats who back Kavanaugh's impeachment Ignore the hype — this is not an impeachment inquiry McCarthy shares 'Stranger Things' parody video criticizing impeachment MORE (D-N.Y.) later Monday.
